file_content.text: I'm sorry, Darth Minax. I had the codes put in place, but the locks seem to have, um, failed.
Half the Imperial army and still the Republic gets inside. Secure the weapon!
You found the Barrager designers among the rest of the rabble you freed, didn't you? Pathetic, idiotic Republic luck.
You have no power here. The Empire's lost the Barrager and Balmorra.
It's over for you, Minax.
You're too blind to realize you've already lost. Balmorra is free.
Open your eyes, Minax.
You're cornered, Darth Minax. Give up the Barrager.
You can give the Barrager to the Republic now. I'll wait.
The Republic's won, have they? Was it at Sobrik? The destroyed Gorinth Brig, perhaps? That festering island you call Bugtown?
Killing you will send quite the message. I hope the Republic takes the hint.
You mistake anger for weakness. A dangerous miscalculation.
Balmorra belongs to the Empire. The Barrager will only remove all doubt.
You were very foolish to come here. Perhaps now you'll understand why.
Look, doctor. The Republic has arrived. We've been expecting you.
You've stolen the Barrager research and a very specific set of prisoners. It's almost like you wanted to meet me--how flattering.
You will free Doctor Carsiri and stand down.
Let the doctor go.
It's the victors who give the orders--and with the Barrager, we will win Balmorra.
Doctor Carsiri had nothing to do with this.
[Lie] He's innocent.
I suppose he's been chatting with Republic Command about the weather, then.
If you think taking hostages is going to stop me, you're wrong.
He means nothing.
Of course. The Republic foolishly soldiers on, even when it's clear we've won.
You don't want Balmorra. You know as well as I do that the Barrager will destroy us.
It consumes a planet's resources until there's nothing left to defend. The Barrager will win Balmorra, all right--and leave it a complete wasteland.
You created a weapon you knew could destroy Balmorra?
But you built it anyway.
Balmorra may die--but they can still call it theirs.
That won't stop the Empire.
Making Balmorra a symbol of the Empire's power.
An Imperial wasteland.
I gotta say, that's not a good design, doc.
What a terrible invention.
Some defenses aren't worth the cost. We know that now. Please... destroy the Barrager.
Mass produce the Barrager, and the Empire would never be defeated. We have to destroy it.
Not important right now.
The Empire's already ravaged Balmorra to finish the Barrager. I'd give anything to see it destroyed.
You're a fine, upstanding citizen of the Republic, doctor. And you deserve your reward.
Balmorra's already sacrificed so much to help us complete the Barrager. I couldn't possibly let you take it now.
One way or another, this is the last time you'll see the Barrager.
We'll see about that.
For your sake, I hope so.
I won't let Doctor Carsiri die for nothing.
This is for the doctor.
Two martyrs in one day. The Republic must be so proud.
After I kill you, then.
Try it, if you dare.
Your efforts are useless. The Empire controls Balmorra, and the Barrager.
We didn't know. The Barrager needs more power than any machine can generate. It must be destroyed.
The Republic may have needed to tear apart Balmorra to discover the Barrager, but the Sith are far more perceptive.
You found the Barrager designers among the rest of the rabble you freed, didn't you? Republic luck.
You couldn't find a traitor even if he was within arm's reach.
You aren't smart enough.
Then after you die, I will kill everyone else I can see.
Doctor Carsiri got me in here, for starters.
Here, I'll help.
He'll die second, then.
I don't think so.
You'd have to live to do that.
Time to surrender.
And we'd like our trophy.
No, I'm just that good.
You Sith are sore losers.
It's really that bad?
